gmaths

Class Mat4Transform

  • java.lang.Object
    • gmaths.Mat4Transform

  • public final class Mat4Transform
extends java.lang.Object
    A static class for a set of methods to create transformation matrices. The matrix is represented in row-column form. Matrices are formed so as to be used in premultiplication of vectors, i.e. matrix x vector.

    • Constructor Summary

      • rotateAroundX

        public static Mat4 rotateAroundX(float angle)
        Creates a 4x4 rotation matrix to rotate around the X axis.
        Parameters:
        angle - The amount of rotation in degrees. Positive values indicate anticlockwise rotation.
        Returns:
        The resulting 4x4 rotation matrix, as a Mat4

      • perspective

        public static Mat4 perspective(float fov,
                               float aspect)
        Creates a perspective matrix with near clip plane at 0.1f and far clip plane at 100f.
        Parameters:
        fov - The field of view for the perspective. Default is 45.
        aspect - The aspect ratio of the display area, which equals width/height, where width and height are floating point values.
        Returns:
        The resulting perspective matrix, as a Mat4

      • perspective

        public static Mat4 perspective(float fov,
                               float aspect,
                               float near,
                               float far)
        Creates a perspective matrix.
        Parameters:
        fov - The field of view for the perspective. Default is 45f.
        aspect - The aspect ratio of the display area, which equals width/height, where width and height are floating point values.
        near - The distance of the near clip plane. Default is 0.1f;
        far - The distance of the far clip plane. Default is 100f.
        Returns:
        The resulting perspective matrix, as a Mat4

      • lookAt

        public static Mat4 lookAt(Vec3 from,
                          Vec3 to,
                          Vec3 worldup)
        Creates a view matrix corresponding to a camera at a given position, looking at a particular target point, with a specified worldup direction. The worldup direction will be changed using the Gram-Schmidt process to be perpendicular to the vector joining the position to the target.
        Parameters:
        from - The camera postion.
        to - The target that the camera is looking at.
        worldup - The up direction for the world.
        Returns:
        The 4x4 viewing matrix, as a Mat4.
